data.title: Good breakfast and bakery
data.text:
I wanted to try a new place for breakfast and searched on line. We showed up on a Friday morning shortly after 8 am and looked over the menu. You order and pay at the counter, receive a number and the meal is delivered to your table. My husband chose the Bowl ($9) house breakfast sausage, tomato sauce, stone ground grits, poached egg, and chives (you can substitute avocado for the sausage). He ate every bite and said it was delicious. I decided on the Breakfast Sammich  ($8) ham, cheddar, fried egg, special sauce, brioche bun and I went with the grits, salad is another option. The grits are delicious and the brioche bun is made in house - so good. We have a sweet tooth and couldn't resist ordering something from the bakery for later. The chocolate chip cookie with sea salt and pumpkin spice shortbread were wonderful. 
We just ordered the regular coffee, but espresso, cappuccino, latte, macchiato and other choices are available. 
The restaurant opens at 7 and by 8:15 it was packed. There are only 20 seats downstairs and about 8-10 seats at sidewalk tables. There is a small loft area up a spiral staircase with more tables and chairs. The location is downtown Birmingham with on-street metered parking.

data.title: Perfect breakfast
data.text: I enjoyed a delicious breakfast with a couple of work friends.  We arrived about 7:15 am.  Walked right up to the counter.  I ordered a yummy biscuit, grits, and one scrambled egg.  The egg was ok but I probably would not order it next time.  The biscuit and grits were to die for.  YUMMY.  The grits were creamy and sticky just right.  The biscuit was tender and was twice as good with blueberry and basil jam smeared on top.  I don't normally treat myself to bread but it was well worth the extra calories.  I highly recommend it.  Small and quaint just my style.

data.title: Funky new bakery downtown
data.text: I have eaten here a few times and it is growing on me. The first time was a disappointment because they were out of several menu items, but they have redeemed themselves on subsequent visits. I think their growing pains are over! Great salads and light lunches. Bakery items are always fresh and delicious.

data.title: Beautiful food
data.text: I've eaten here three times and never had a less-than dish. Literally. My only complaint is the staff, while polite, aren't always efficient. On two different visits the forgot our hot drinks completely (these were morning visits) and needed reminders. But still a great choice.

data.title: Hit the spot!
data.text:
Went to this place for the first time last weekend.  The food is fresh and prepared with care.  The coffee was very good.  I had a straight espresso shot and it was not bitter at all.  I ordered an Eggs Benedict with salmon on top.  Top notch.   I ate every bite.  Unfortunately, they ran out of English Muffins, but after tasting their brioche bread (used in the Eggs Benedict as an English muffin replacement) I would expect them to be very good.

The seating is a bit limited, so if you go during a rush, you'll find yourself standing around.  There is no system for who gets a table.  There is no staff assisting with placing customers at tables in a proper order.  Unfortunately, while we were waiting to be seated, people took the table we were waiting on... not once, but twice.  These were people that were in line behind us while ordering.  Thankfully, the tables open up at a fairly regular pace and we only had to wait a couple more minutes for the third table to open up.

The deviled eggs are a must.  Very good taste and texture.  I will return to this restaurant.

data.title: lunch for four
data.text: Met friends from out of town and went based on a review our friend had read.  Busy at noon hour, seating a little challenge but quickly and cheerfully resolved.  Friendly staff, anxious to make sure everything was the way we wanted.  Attentive staff but not a nuisance.  Four different meals ordered, and all were pleased with their orders.  Strawberry scone was good and moist.  Limited menu, but felt it was all quality AND most importantly it was great.  Definitely will return - just wish there had been at least 2 or 3 more choices.  And a real plus for me, absolutely no one responded to a "thank you" with "my pleasure".

data.title: Really Great Chicken Salad Sandwich
data.text:
Stopped today because thought it did breakfast late but I was wrong . They stop breakfast at 11:00 am . My niece had the chicken  salad  which she said was fresh and fantastic . I had their coffee with brioche and a cookie ( breakfast :( )
Which were fresh and delicious !!

data.title: Chicken salad sandwich and a side of potato and asparagus salad
data.text: Delicious sandwich with avocado and a little red onion on a fresh  sesame seed bun. Perfect bite sized pieces of chicken, very savory. I also ordered the cold potato and asparagus salad with the vinaigrette. It was also delicious. And I knew the moment I walked through the door that I would be having coffee and I had a coconut milk latte which was wonderful. I would definitely go back again for some quiche.

data.title: The best everything
data.text: I have a hard and fast rule when doing reviews: I never give 5 stars to a place without skim milk for the coffee.  However, I'm breaking that rule big time right now. F&F has THE best coffee, THE best food, and THE best baked goods I have had in ages. The two staff members that took care of me today we're both absolutely wonderful as well...kind, helpful, and sincere. The decor (with a split level dining room) was funky and fresh. I really, really loved F&F. If I were from Birmingham, I would be an instant regular. Go.

data.title: Much ado about nothing
data.text: very small, and expensive.   Food is just average.   Coffee was good.   Service was below average.   Very disappointing.

data.title: little glasses / big taste
data.text: Just ate there.  Damn good vittles.  Nice decor.  Helpful staff.  The turkey sammich rocked...so much that I wish it had been twice as big!  Portions are slightly smaller than average, but heck, most of Americans need to be eating smaller portions so...  Good tea.  Only strange thing was the small glasses.  I had to get up three times to go get a refill of my tea.  They chose "hip" little glasses for the optics r/t than considering practicality.  In the words of F. Lloyd Wright, "Form follows function."  I would definitely go back again.

data.title: New Bakery !!!
data.text: A new little bakery in the Downtown area.  Opens early serving breakfast.  I tried a cinnamon brioche - delicious and pretty, a Nutella pop tart- a must for coco late lovers, and a snicker doodle cookie-yummy! The dark chocolate sea salt cookies are chock full of flavor.  The lemon pound cakes have a nice flavor, but a bit too dry for me (and the others in my group).  Blueberry pop tarts also very good. I will return!  Parking is dicey - streets idea on 2nd or 3rd.  Give it a try!

data.title: Where the Elite Meet for Breakfast, Brunch or Lunch
data.text: I had an exceptional morning meal at Feast & Forest...a breakfast sandwich featuring a homemade biscuit, handmade sausage, cheese slice and a perfect (runny) egg.  The cafe and bakery is an example of the renaissance underway in downtown Birmingham.
